page.title: 11Local History(cont)
page.content: Everatt,Fillingham and Belton.The other industry is an agricultural engineer's employing about 20 people but owing to the present economic climate,this business is closing in September 1985.The other industry is Harrison's builders,employing about 20 people.The village has a blacksmith,who is a recent arrival,not descended from a previous blacksmith. Quite a few of the village men,travel to work at the steel-works in Scunthorpe. There is one small village shop/post office and two public houses. As stated in the History of Eastoft the bed of the old River Don was covered with daffodils in Spring;now this has been filled in and levelled and is a pleasant,tidy village green.
